text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in Norwegian newspapers this morning.
-As of today European airlines may fly to all destinations in Norway. However, price reductions for passengers are not expected in the nearest future.
-The Central Bank says too much capacity in the Norwegian banking sector will force through further cost cuts and rationalisation.

-Work on the railway to Oslo's new airport, Gardermoen, continues today after state-owned railway company NSB and Scandinavian Rock Group (SRG) met on Monday. SRG has threathened to stop working unless it is paid 65-70 million crowns for unexpected extra costs.
-Norsk Hydro is planning to expand aluminium smelter capacity in Norway. In order to secure power supply, Hydro may consider building power plants abroad.
-The British Serious Fraud Office has asked the two Norwegian brokerhouses Carnegie and Fiba Nordic to explain their relations with Morgan Grenfell's former portofolio manager Peter Young.
